articles.title: The ventilator question: Why Covid-19 patients starve of oxygen - India Today
articles.description: A study in China found that 53 per cent Covid-19 patients died of respiratory problems. In many cases, the patients were able to breathe mechanically but the body lacked oxygen.
articles.content: Health experts and authorities maintain that only about 15 per cent of Covid-19 patients actually need hospitalization, treatment in ICU, oxygen supply for breathing or ventilator support. Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID-19 becomes seriously ill… [+4068 chars]

articles.description: In Italy, an analysis of more than 127,700 COVID-19 cases found that 52.9% of all infected people were men and 47.1% women. Among Italy’s first 14,860 deaths, almost 68% were men.

articles.author: Jonathan Corum, Carl Zimmer
articles.title: How Coronavirus Mutates and Spreads - The New York Times
articles.description: The virus has mutated. But that doesn’t mean it’s getting deadlier.
articles.content:
The coronavirus is an oily membrane packed with genetic instructions to make millions of copies of itself. The instructions are encoded in 30,000 letters of RNA a, c, g and u which the infected cell reads and translates into many kinds of virus proteins.
RNA… [+19261 chars]
